title: Festival of Ghosts
story_summary: The people of Stenograd gather for public rituals to remember those erased by the BCI. As lost citizens return, old roles and blame become unclear. Together, everyone creates a new civic pact, promising justice and making sure no one is forgotten again.

official.headline: Citywide remembrance
official.anchor_line: Remembrance parades and forums invite all citizens to honor memories and share stories across Stenograd.
official.contextual_reframing: Collective reflection strengthens Stenograd's social fabric while reinforcing civic unity and inclusion.

official.headline: Historic civic pact
official.anchor_line: Citizens from every district unite to ratify a new pact based on memory, justice, and shared values.
official.contextual_reframing: Participatory dialogue exemplifies the system's commitment to continuous improvement and transparent governance.

official.headline: New era of trust
official.anchor_line: Public commemoration of the BCI welcomes returning citizens as Stenograd embraces shared history and healing.
official.contextual_reframing: A renewed focus on trust and community propels Stenograd into a stronger and more resilient future.

underground.headline: Who gets erased?
underground.anchor_line: Vigils and stories erupt, but ghosted records stay sealed  -  truth still locked behind blank screens.
underground.contextual_reframing: Mourners demand answers while officials spin unity. System silence speaks louder than ceremonies.

underground.headline: History on lockdown
underground.anchor_line: Citizens push for the real story, but leaked Council memos reveal new attempts to bury BCI's secrets.
underground.contextual_reframing: Justice means opening the files, not burying memories. Some Council members still fear the whole truth.

underground.headline: Ghosts return home
underground.anchor_line: Commemoration brings ghosted citizens back, but scars run deep as the city rewrites its own past.
underground.contextual_reframing: Memory can't be engineered, no matter how many speeches. Stenograd faces what was lost  -  and what was done  -  together.
